abstract: Pep Boys said late on Tuesday that it had agreed to end its proposed $1 billion sale to the Gores Group, after the private equity firm raised concerns about the company’s deteriorating financial health.
snippet: Pep Boys said late on Tuesday that it had agreed to end its proposed $1 billion sale to the Gores Group, after the private equity firm raised concerns about the company’s deteriorating financial health.
lead_paragraph: Pep Boys said late Tuesday that it had agreed to end its proposed $1 billion sale to the Gores Group, after the private equity firm raised concerns about the company’s deteriorating financial health.

headline.main: Pep Boys Terminates Sale to Private Equity Firm

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: The initiative is part of Pepsi’s attempt to refresh its brand and take advantage of the involvement of young people on social media platforms.
snippet: The initiative is part of Pepsi’s attempt to refresh its brand and take advantage of the involvement of young people on social media platforms.
lead_paragraph: In a world where people are increasingly turning away from sweet sodas and calorie-packed beverages, Pepsi’s ad campaign “Live for Now” is attempting to refresh the brand and its image.

headline.main: Pepsi and Twitter Announce Partnership on Ad Campaign
